values:
Currently on Day 16 of the Bikram 30 Day challenge, and I'm 2 classes ahead, 12 more to finishing the challenge. 

Compared to my very first Bikram class, I can truly tell that my fitness has improved leaps and bounds. There are so many indications of that - my heart rate doesn't pound as hard anymore, I don't feel giddy or want to pass out, I can hold all the poses perfectly even for Kathip's standard, and best of all, I no longer have the phobia of Triangle Pose. 

All of it thrills me. I am fitter. I am leaner. My arms are smaller. I am stronger. I have the inner strength and determination to survive anything, simply because I want to change my life. 

Looking forward to the end of the challenge though - so I can get back to my Vinyasa and Flow classes!

Planning my Yoga schedule for the week has got to be one of the things I look forward to every week. So I have 10 classes with Yoga Movement, and they have 6 different types of classes, 5 if I exclude Yoga Zen. While I do not prefer their lousy slippery mats, their small toilet and policy of charging for water and towels, I do enjoy being in a place where I do not know anyone, experiencing new instructors and cultures. I found ways to get around the small toilet, by heading straight home after the class. I want to go to the different studios to see if they have different towel colors.

My yoga foundation is strong enough to allow me to go to different studios, and know that I will be able to keep up. I really enjoy that. It makes me confident. Sometimes I'm amazed how strong I've gotten, and it excites me that I still have so far more to go. It's a never-ending journey!
I'm suddenly afraid to meet you tomorrow. I don't know what you are expecting, and I don't know how to ask what it is that you expect without me looking like a fool.

Somehow managed to become zen about my current predicament, no longer as anxious as last week to get things moving. We'll see how things go, whether something comes out of it or not, either way I don't lose anything.

There's some merit in what you both say. I am used to getting my own way. I get frustrated when I don't, and I show it. And that isn't who I want to be. I should not expect other people to give in to me all the time. If that's how I'm being perceived, it's sending the wrong message to people.

Thank you for giving me something to think about. I really appreciate it. There are some changes I need to make in my life and I need to make them quick.
Was actually relieved when you cancelled because I wasn't looking forward. But now I'm feeling pissed because you are ignoring me! Asshole
This feels serious. But I'm not too sure if I'm that into you, or just projecting onto you.
Don't feel ready, but going ahead regardless
It means a lot to me that you remembered.
Spent the better half of an hour putting facebook "friends" into the Restricted List. Bye, now I don't have to worry about what you see on my account.

Looking back, it's easy to see when a mistake's been made
To regret a choice that seemed like a decent idea at the time.
But if we use our best judgement, and listen to our hearts
We are more likely to see that we chose wisely
And avoided the deepest most painful regret of them all
The regret that comes from letting something amazing pass you by.

The best thing for me to do now is to do my work well, be hardworking, conscientious, and keep my nose out of gossip.

For my own sanity I will also keep my personal life separate, no more telling colleagues what I am doing in my own free time. Only friends get to know.

Feeling guilty about being away for so long, because I think these trips (while perfectly reasonable to me) somehow makes my boss think I don't do a good job. Feeling nervous about returning to work too, because I have to face colleagues that I've realised are all my competitors, and favoritism is a huge thing here.

There's a difference between knowing you have to leave, and know where to go.

First the boss said to customize your own one-slider, making it as special and creative as you can. You collate it, changing all our background colors, shifting the boxes around, standardizing to your font. Now you tell us to do up the slide in your ugly template instead.

You are useless, you suck and I hate working with you.

Feb's schedule for 7.30pm is looking pretty good, it's time I remind myself of the 10kg new year resolution I just set myself last month. Plus the 3kg I gained back while switching off for the past 2 weeks. Sometimes I hate myself for giving in, but the past 6 months was not a lie. I did do all the hard work. And I did push myself to overcome my nature. I need to find back the determination and get back.
Was at the 'Strategic Priorities' meeting today, and with every new work target set by the boss I became more and more convicted that I'm doing something I no longer believe it.

Solo trip was.. solo. Perhaps I take my independence and self-reliance for granted. I refuse to empathize when people are timid, and let themselves get in the way. It wasn't easy for me to get over myself during exchange, but I did. It was like the ultimate rites of growing up for me, and although I wished I overcome the barrier in a shorter period of time, I'm still proud that I managed to. So I refuse to empathize, especially if you are not doing anything to change the fact that you let yourself get in the way of life. Expecting someone to take care of you is just.. stupid.

"If you give the people of Congo $10, what would they buy?" "They will buy some soap, because looking clean is a big concern. They will buy food, because at least they will live until tomorrow, and they will use their last dollar to buy a shirt, because they have some pride too" Makes me feel ashamed to be so frivolous. Makes me realise how lucky we are, to be living in a first world country where we take basic necessities for granted.
2013 Jan - Hong Kong March - Bali May - Japan June - Bangkok (work) July - Vietnam (work) August - Malacca Sept - Taipei Nov - Hong Kong Dec - Bangkok I may have a problem..

What happens when you lose what you never really had, when it was all in your head. 

I lie in bed thinking about various scenarios, but lately it has become more and more clear to me that these scenarios are just, in my head.

I recently got to go to the Bird Park twice because of work. Once for site recee, the other for the actual meeting that we were holding. Both times the weather refused to cooperate, and it absolutely poured. Our complimentary tickets were for naught in the end because I was unable to go traipsing to see the Birds of Paradise, nor the hawks. I did manage to see the flamingos (only because our meeting room was right outside the Flamingo Lake) and the penguins. 

The penguins enclosure was absolutely awful. Picture numerous penguins littered around a room the size of a classroom, with mirrors all around to simulate a larger environment. The pool they had was about 1m in depth. I saw a King Penguin, just staring into space. In fact, I didn't even see any activity in the enclosure. Compared to their natural habitat, I would be depressed in the tiny space too. 

But it does bring to mind one question. How are we different from them in our HBD flats anyway.
Managed to salvage my GPA for my final semester. Yessss I got the GPA i wanted!

Final class of my SMU life was class party for creative writing class today. We surprised the prof with our thank you slides, I think he has never gotten that from a class before. I'm very very happy this semester.  I'll remember this sem as the sem where I never had to stay up late chionging work, was never unhappy with groupmates, had time to do what I love, hung out with people who had the same goals and interests as me, and because I see actual results matching the effort I put in, sometimes even more.  

I'm grateful for everything this semester, for being so happy and satisfied with my life now. Thank you thank you to whoever's looking out for me. I won't forget this wonderful ending to my university life :)
Come monday, I guess the rest of my life will be settled.
things are going very well for me.. very very well. thank you whoever is looking out for me up there. i really appreciate it :)

Won my first ever gold medal in the team event this weekend! The feeling was awesome.. I felt the adrenaline, the power and the knowledge that people standing behind were rooting for me. Simply amazing..
Pushing so hard in my last semester. This is the first time my recess week's gonna be so damn busy. But I'm living every single moment of it, and I really treasure it. Fight on!

Once in awhile somebody comes along and inspires you to be the best person you can be. You might not know it, but I am the best person I can be when I'm with you. 

Merry Christmas everyone!
So lost. I don't even know what kind of job I want to be doing in future. How do I even start applying for jobs?

I love rain. I love the rain especially if I'm in the library mugging and it rains. It gets all dark and gloomy and the temperature drops to freezing cold, and I feel more motivated to study. Or I just stare at the window watching the raindrops. But now that I've ended my exams, it is time to stop raining. It is time to stop raining because when it rains I have to wear jackets and take buses and I can't walk outside.

studying alone in the big library is sad. realizing I've bid all my modules next semester by myself in my last semester is sad. why are there people always surrounded by their friends, so popular, never having to be alone, and why are there people like me who doesn't have any friends. so many acquaintances but no true friend.

Good news on my marketing projects this semester- yesterday I received an email from my CRM prof: 

General comments:
The CRM project groups and students this year are very strong.  It is perhaps one of the strongest I had taught over the years.  Hence the project marks shown here have already been moderated to fit the required distribution of marks in SMU.
 
Comments:
This is an excellent report, covering comprehensively CRM issues.  Well thought through recommendations.  I particularly liked the structure you had used, going by the problems, objectives, recommendations and measure of success for each section.  This is the best report of the class.
 
Adjusted grade: A

Today I received another piece of good news- my SBM team made it to the Interbrand consulting finals! I'm rather excited but a bit bummed that we'd have to present while the other groups get to relax. But getting chosen means we did well so it's still awesome :)

I'm planning for my modules to take in my last semester, and I've never faced such an agonizing decision. I need to decide which is the last module to take! And given that the only mod I ever wanted has an exam timing that clashes with a compulsory one, anything else is just gonna seem second best.

At Week 11/13 of the semester, and the last round of bidding just 3 days away, I'm feeling the nerves. What if I'm not really to enter the working world? I don't look forward to losing the freedom, not sure if I want to commit myself to the standard hours of work. University life wasn't what I had expected in JC. 

It's a public holiday and I'll expect a full house where I'm going later. How sad is that.

When I was in Mexico, I dyed my hair to a lighter shade of brown.. which eventually turned into a dark blondish-yellowish color, which I think must have been due to the strong Mexican sun and the hours I spent in the outside climbing those pyramids and chilling by the pool by myself. 


I particularly love this picture because everyone was looking so tanned and healthy here.

I was at the Houston airport checking in and the lady at the security gantry actually complimented my hair color, saying it was a nice "strawberry blond" color. I still have no idea what that means haha. 



Then I came back to Singapore and everyone complained that my hair was too "lian". 

And truth be told, I felt that my hair color stood out so much here. It wasn't the case overseas. So the day after my birthday, I decided to dye it back to dark brown and get a perm at the same time. 



I guess I used my hair color as a way of fitting into the culture. It sucks that our society judges people for their hair color- think Xiaxue, but it sucks even more that the judgement actually played a part in affecting my decision to change back my hair color.
I wish people could understand the feelings I have for Grey's Anatomy.
Hugely unmotivated in life now, I wish I could change it all.

SINGAPORE: The next phase for Singapore's education system will be one that is student-centric and focused on values.

Speaking at the Ministry of Education's work plan seminar on Thursday, Education Minister Heng Swee Keat said while the overall foundation of the system is strong, the ministry wants to sharpen its efforts in holistic education to better prepare Singaporeans for the 21st century.

Mr Heng said: "We need personal values to enable each of us to have the confidence, self awareness, grit and determination to succeed. We need moral values, such as respect, responsibility, care and appreciation towards others to guide each of us to be a socially responsible person.

"We need values of citizenship. As a young nation with a short history of independence, we must have informed, rugged and resilient citizens who can stay united to overcome crisis and adversities which we must expect to happen from time to time."

He said the ministry will do this in three broad areas.

One way is to introduce a new Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) module by 2013 which will focus on values and character development.

The new CCE curriculum will bring together Civics and Moral Education, National Education, Co-Curricular Activities (CCA) among others.

The CCE is expected to be infused into lessons, such as Mother Tongue and literature.

And to place greater emphasis on holistic and balanced participation in CCA rather than just achievement, the ministry will also review LEAPS (Leadership, Enrichment, Achievement, Participation and Service), a grading scheme for CCA.

In addition, Mr Heng said the ministry will review the School Excellence Model and Masterplan of Awards, which were introduced in 1998.

This is to realign them to be more student-centric while reducing the amount of administrative work needed.

Mr Heng also emphasised the importance of engaging parents and the community to achieve these outcomes.

- CNA/fa

http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/1154788/1/.html
------------------------------------------------------------------

For an entire country focused on results and excellence ever since its inception, trying to change the standard by which to grade students is but an uphill task, if I may undertake such a massive understatement. Even in the workplace now, for all the emphasis employers place on leadership positions and active involvement in activities, your GPA is but the first criteria they look at. 

So, focus on getting the As, before you plunge yourself into the holistic and balanced participation in CCAs.

We got the USEA consulting project! That and with $1000 stipend for doing the project, it is sure going into my post-grad travel plans! Of course it will mean that my workload will be getting super heavy from now on. Well better time management is needed then. 

Perhaps it is time now to start thinking about what to do.. nao that I've achieved my short term goal of perming and dyeing black my hair. So not used to it though. Next up is to get office wardrobe.

Happy birthday to me! The past year has been a very enriching and special year to me. And I can say I learnt so much more in this past year than I ever did in my entire life. 



Well firstly, I underestimated the effect that going on exchange will have on me. I thought my homesickness would be balanced out by all the fun and excitment of making new friends. And not only did I get into trouble, I also made my first 2 enemies that I would forever remember for the rest of my life because of the tar they made. Hopefully in time I would let it go.  

I wish that for every day I spent crying in Mexico, I would make it up with a day of happiness. 

The independence I've gained, in my emotional state, and street-wiseness, I would never have learnt them if I haven't gone away. I'd never learnt to appreciate my family otherwise. Never learnt to cook, to wash, to take care of myself, to be wiser and smarter. 

And may I lead a life of no regrets, become wiser in my dealings with people, and learn to read them better.
I have a thing for guys that are 39 years old. HAHAHA.

Should have, would have, could have. Life could have been so much more different. But no here I am doing my project and feeling inadequate, unhappy, dissatisfied and stressed. 

People who meet me for the first time think I am this pulled-together person. But in fact I'm just as lost as anyone.
